definition: to eat on the sly/to pilfer food/to be unfaithful
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

sentences.english: That's what she gets for eating my roast beef sandwich.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，这就是你偷吃我的烧牛肉三明治的下场。

sentences.english: Cows, on the other hand, routinely break down fences to get at corn.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面，这些牛总是冲破栅栏去偷吃玉米。

sentences.english: It's the eating of the forbidden fruit by Adam and Eve.
sentences.chinese: 这就是亚当和夏娃偷吃了禁果。

sentences.english: Oh, Mimi is eating my chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 哦，咪咪在偷吃我的巧克力。

sentences.english: She's lost several jobs for  pilfering food, and has even resorted to shoplifting.
sentences.chinese: 因为偷吃她已经丢掉了多份工作，甚至还在商店盗窃。

sentences.english: One day, the couple herded chicken onto the grain-sunning ground to eat others' grain.
sentences.chinese: 一天，老两口把鸡赶到晒谷场上偷吃别人谷子。

sentences.english: We bought a sausage that the crows steal and was on TV…
sentences.chinese: 在这里买到电视上播过的乌鸦也偷吃的香肠。

sentences.english: If you want a pretence to whip a dog, say that he ate the frying-pan.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想找个理由去打一条狗，就说它偷吃了煎锅。

sentences.english: Tom is sneakily munching an apple in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆在厨房里偷吃苹果。

sentences.english: One considered putting locks on her cabinets to keep her son from sneaking food in the middle of the night.
sentences.chinese: 一位母亲想把贮藏柜的门都加锁，防止儿子半夜偷吃。

sentences.english: "In most cases, he's cheating to fill an emotional void, " Neuman says.
sentences.chinese: 多数情况下，他偷吃是为了填补情感上的空虚。

definition: to cheat on one's spouse/to have an affair
to peep/to peek/to steal a glance
to carry on a clandestine love affair
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
